perturbation.original_text: Initial Term has the meaning given to it in clause 12.1. Products: As defined in Schedule 1 and includes any other products developed by the Supplier and which the Supplier may permit the Distributor, by express notice in writing, to distribute in the Territory. Term: the term of this agreement, as determined in accordance with clause 11. Territory: means the territory specified in Schedule 2.
perturbation.changed_text: Products: As defined in Schedule 1 and includes any other products developed by the Supplier and which the Supplier may permit the Distributor, by express notice in writing, to distribute in the Territory. Term: the term of this agreement, as determined in accordance with clause 11. Territory: means the territory specified in Schedule 2.
perturbation.explanation: The definition of Initial Term referring to clause 12.1 has been removed. Clause 11.1 mentions the 'Initial Term', so the clause referencing it has been removed, creating uncertainty about the length of the contract.

perturbation.original_text:
5.  Prices and payment
5.1 The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be the Price, as set out in Schedule 4.
perturbation.changed_text:
5.  Prices and payment
5.1 The prices to be paid by the Distributor to the Supplier for the Products are to be determined. The Supplier will notify the Distributor in advance of any price changes.
perturbation.explanation: By changing the pricing clause from being specified in Schedule 4 to being 'determined', and the Distributor being notified, there is uncertainty as Schedule 4 is still referenced in other parts of the agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
Schedule 4
Prices
Aria Stem $610
Origin Stem $610
Remedy Stem $610
Logical Cup $450
Logical Liner $210
Metal Head $240
Ceramic Head $340
BiPolar Head $250
PS / CR Femoral Component $550
Insert $340
Tibia Tray $440
Patella $70
perturbation.explanation: The prices in Schedule 4 have been removed. This creates a contradiction with the pricing terms mentioned elsewhere in the document.
